segments.title: Explaining Density Concept
segments.summary: Density is explained as mass per unit volume, with examples like water (1g/cm³) and iron (7.8g/cm³). The segment discusses how density represents how packed or crowded matter is in a given space.

segments.title: Density and Floating
segments.summary: Explains how objects with lower density float while those with higher density sink. Uses examples of oil floating on water and iron bolt sinking in water.

segments.title: Water Density Properties
segments.summary: Details how water's density changes with temperature, reaching maximum density at 4°C. Explains why ice has lower density than water due to molecular structure creating gaps.

segments.title: Air Density Variation
segments.summary: Describes how air density varies with altitude, being higher near Earth's surface and lower at higher altitudes due to atmospheric pressure differences.

segments.title: Earth's Density Layers
segments.summary: Explains how Earth's structure formed based on density differences, with heavier metals sinking to form the core and lighter silicates floating to form the crust.
